result.execSummary:
The defendant Randel J Otterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 419, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.  Granted Good Time.  Given credit for 1 day.  Concurrent to Count #4
Consecutive to: any other sentence and concurrent to Count #4.
